comments.body: should these be alphabetical, like the next section?
I think they probably shouldn't as we want the best demos on top to give first time users a better first time experience.

How are we determining "best demos"? I mean, the flexible space toolbar is pretty sweet, if you're trying to see how easy it is to make a material app. Some of the "Components" demos are quite compelling too. The "Fitness" demo is great, but if what you want is to see if you can implement some of the more elaborate things in the material design spec, it's not obvious what it's showing you -- you can, after all, get the same effect on a Web page with an animated GIF. :-)

Maybe we should randomise the order and use metrics to determine which demos people look at the most...

I think this list should be ordered mightiest-first. I would guess that most people will only try a few demos and they're most likely to try the first couple from this list. We may want to reconsider the order and  even the contents of this list.

This array could also be generated from a global list of kDeoms = [new WeatherDemo(), ...] by:
()=> new GalleryItem(demo.title, builder: () => demo);
Sadly that doesn't work because kDemos wants the route name on the instance and this line wants the route name on the class.
